repnme.cdata!:
Tajikistan - Public Employment for
            Sustainable Agriculture and Water Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Employment for
            Sustainable Agriculture and Water Management Project for
            Tajikistan were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk
            to development outcome was moderate; Bank performance was
            satisfactory; and grantee performance was satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes: approach, scope and timeframe for
            similar emergency response projects. The project experience
            has confirmed the viability of combining a public works
            approach with the more conventional contracted works
            approach to irrigation and drainage infrastructure
            rehabilitation. Limiting the scope of emergency
            interventions to mostly physical system improvements may
            have been appropriate in the first instance, but an early
            subsequent evolution to sustainable development
            interventions that include well focused institutional and
            agricultural support programs would seem to be called for.
            Manual labor contract and payment arrangements: the concepts
            and processes developed and applied for contracting and
            paying for manual labor works under the project, aimed at
            ensuring transparency and preventing corruption, were
            considered to be sound and replicable for future similar
            projects. Social targeting for public works programs aimed
            at providing temporary manual labor employment as a means of
            supplementing income for the poorest, most vulnerable and
            jobless members of the rural communities, the process of
            setting and applying criteria for operation of the programs
            and selection of beneficiaries is a crucial and difficult
            one. Involvement of women: from the responsible
            Non-Government Organizations (NGOs), the already achieved
            level of inclusion of women workers into the project's
            manual labor force could be further increased in future
            similar projects by applying a few simple additional
            incentive measures including (i) assigning men and women to
            separate work fronts and locations, (ii) allocating women
            workers to the smaller-scale works with lower lifting and
            throwing requirements, and (iii) arranging where possible
            for women to be assigned to work sites that were close to
            their homes. Supervision, facilitation, coordination and
            management arrangements: the levels of supervision,
            facilitation, coordination and management provided by all of
            the implementation partners to the project was seemingly
            very high compared to other types of development project.

repnme.cdata!:
Tajikistan - An emergency response to the
            financial crisis and rising food costs

abstracts.cdata!:
With the funding from the European Union
            (EU) Food Price Crisis Response Trust Fund, this project
            created 402,000 man/days of work for 10,600 beneficiaries
            from November 24, 2010 toDecember 31, 2011 providing an
            average income of roughly US$230 per person and benefitting
            approximately 43,300 of the most food insecure rural
            households (about 302,000 people). The renovated
            infrastructure included 1,820 km of irrigation canals and
            317 km of collector and drainage canals, producing 44,276
            hectares of higher quality irrigated arable land in the
            project districts.

14594811.trustfund:
TF097691-PUBLIC EMPLOYMENT FOR
            SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE AND WATER MANAGEMENT PROJ

repnme.cdata!:
Tajikistan - Public Employment for
            Sustainable Agriculture and Water Management Project :
            emergency project paper

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Public Employment
            for Sustainable Agriculture and Water Management Project for
            Tajikistan is to generate temporal employment and
            rehabilitate irrigation and drainage infrastructure in
            selected districts in the Khatlon oblast as a means to
            increase household food security. The requested grant will
            finance a public works program to provide temporary
            employment to food insecure rural people, by rehabilitating
            the farm level irrigation and drainage network in selected
            high food insecurity districts. It thus responds to a
            significant drop in remittance income due to the global
            financial crisis, which has severely compromised current
            household food security, and to the medium-term constraint
            to domestic food production caused by inadequate drainage
            and irrigation. The project will also contribute to improved
            food security at a national level by financing the technical
            assistance needed to introduce water basin management as the
            basis for overall management of Tajikistan's water resources.
